unnormalised: Rental Agreements Getting a Makeover, Mumbai Tenants Say "Chalo!"
normalised: rental agreements getting a makeover, Mumbai tenants say "Chalo!"

unnormalised: Mumbai: Forget those dusty old agreements typed on your uncle's typewriter! Rental agreements are finally getting a much-needed refresh, thanks to increased awareness and tech solutions. Landlords, take note!
normalised: Mumbai: forget those dusty old agreements typed on your uncle's typewriter! rental agreements are finally getting a much needed refresh, thanks to increased awareness and tech solutions. landlords, take note!

unnormalised: Experts like Dr. Sharma from the National Housing Bank, predict a rise in digitally signed agreements, streamlining the process for both owners and tenants. Think fewer trips to the notary and more chai breaks!
normalised: experts like doctor Sharma from the National Housing Bank, predict a rise in digitally signed agreements, streamlining the process for both owners and tenants. think fewer trips to the notary and more chai breaks!

unnormalised: New features like digitally verifiable IDs and clauses addressing maintenance responsibilities (remember that leaky tap, Mrs. Iyer?) are becoming commonplace.
normalised: new features like digitally verifiable I D S and clauses addressing maintenance responsibilities (remember that leaky tap, misses Iyer?) are becoming commonplace.

unnormalised: Rent increases are also under the spotlight. Gone are the days of arbitrary Rs. 5000 hikes! Agreements now often specify a reasonable percentage increase, tied to the Consumer Price Index.
normalised: rent increases are also under the spotlight. gone are the days of arbitrary rupee five thousand hikes! agreements now often specify a reasonable percentage increase, tied to the Consumer Price Index.

unnormalised: "It's about time!" exclaimed Rohan, a tenant living in a 500 sq ft apartment in Bandra. "Now, hopefully, landlords will think twice before hiking rent to unrealistic levels."
normalised: "it's about time!" exclaimed Rohan, a tenant living in a five hundred square feet apartment in Bandra. "now, hopefully, landlords will think twice before hiking rent to unrealistic levels."

unnormalised: The changes aim to create fairer and more transparent rental relationships, benefiting both parties. So, next time you’re signing a lease, read the fine print carefully – and maybe offer your landlord some laddoos as a gesture of goodwill! Remember the stamp duty in Maharashtra is applicable, irrespective of online registration.
normalised: the changes aim to create fairer and more transparent rental relationships, benefiting both parties. so, next time you’re signing a lease, read the fine print carefully – and maybe offer your landlord some laddoos as a gesture of goodwill! remember the stamp duty in Maharashtra is applicable, irrespective of online registration.
